text:
VTEX is a multi-tenant SaaS
digital commerce platform,

but we could see that we're
overrunning our budget
related to investments in observability,

or even overall budget
for cloud at that point.
So, it was very important for us
to work with a partner such as AWS
to redesign from the ground up.

So, what we built with AWS
was a observability stack
that is based primarily on open source.

So on the application side,
we leverage OpenTelemetry

We're using Amazon Managed
Prometheus primarily
for metrics purposes
related to our services and applications,
to evaluate how our customers

and our customers' stores are
performing on our platform.

So in terms of feedback
from the developers

after we roll out this
new architecture with AWS,

was that there are
substantial improvements
on when it comes to data governance
and governance of policy controls.
We're still in this journey
and the next steps there
were actually to evaluate Managed Grafana
to improve the end user experience.
So, visualizations is something
that we're tackling next with AWS.

VTEX is producing more than
four terabytes of logs per day,
about 150 million active time series,
and also more than 2 billion events
or 2 billion spans per day.
So, that gives you a sense for the scale
of the solution that we have with AWS.
